intro: Acetosella rhombeo-ovata, commonly known as the ovate sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped or ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, blooming in early spring. Acetosella rhombeo-ovata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and grassy slopes. It is often found growing in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
